str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
And, even, also, namely.
From pseudes and prophetes; a spurious prophet, i.e. Pretended foreteller or religious impostor.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
And, even, also, namely.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From pseudes and didaskalos; a spurious teacher, i.e. Propagator of erroneous Christian doctrine.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To bring in secretly, be at hand. From para and eisago; to lead in aside, i.e. Introduce surreptitiously.
Destruction, ruin, loss, perishing; eternal ruin. From a presumed derivative of apollumi; ruin or loss.
From haireomai; properly, a choice, i.e. a party or disunion.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A lord, master, or prince. Perhaps from deo and posis; an absolute ruler.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To bring upon; meet: I cause to be imputed to. From epi and ago; to superinduce, i.e. Inflict, charge.
Swift, quick, impending. From tachos; curt, i.e. Impending.
Destruction, ruin, loss, perishing; eternal ruin. From a presumed derivative of apollumi; ruin or loss.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
